Application.Utils

Class DumpData

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application.Utils.DumpData

  • @Controller
public class DumpData
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class used to create and download data related to a Scenario.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Corti Lorenzo, Tocchetti Andrea

    • Method Detail

      • dumpData

        @RequestMapping(value="/get-data",
                method={GET,POST})
private void dumpData(@RequestParam(value="idScenario")
                                                                                            int idScenario,
                                                                                            javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse httpServletResponse)
                                                                                     throws DumpCreationException
        Creates a data dump for a given Scenario, including:
        • Details about the Scenario
        • Details about the Quiz
        • Details about the Questions and Answers
        • Details about the Visions
        • Details about the Matches played
        • Details about the Feeling expressed by Users
        Parameters:
        idScenario - Integer specifying the identifier for a given Scenario.
        httpServletResponse - see HttpServletResponse.
        Throws:
        DumpCreationException - DumpCreationException, exception in creating the data dump.

      • getData

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getData(int idScenario,
                                                   java.lang.String query)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Private utility function querying the database separately to get the relevant data of a Scenario.
        Parameters:
        idScenario - Integer specifying the identifier for a given Scenario.
        query - String containing the query to be executed.
        Returns:
        Results of the query formatted a List of Arrays of Strings.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - see SQLException.
